str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A plant, that which is planted. From phuteuo; trans-planting, i.e. a shrub or vegetable.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In heaven, belonging to heaven, heavenly, from heaven. From ouranos; celestial, i.e. Belonging to or coming from the sky.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To plant, set. From a derivative of phuo; to set out in the earth, i.e. Implant; figuratively, to instil doctrine.

word: will be pulled up by its roots.
parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To root out, pluck up by the roots. From ek and rhizoo; to uproot.
